intro: Podalyria uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower rockweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in high-altitude environments. Its flowers are small and usually pale blue or purple, and it produces legume pods that contain its seeds. Podalyria uniflora is adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
